trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of regional anaesthesia on the vessels of the upper limb in patients operated for vascular access
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of brachial plexus block on regional hemodynamics of the upper limb in patients operated for vascular access : Supraclavicular approach versus infraclavicular approach

conditions.healthcondition: regional hemodynamics of the upper limb after brachial plexus block

interventions.interventions:
Common management for both groups will include the following:
1. No pre-medication 2. Standard monitoring: ECG, non invasive blood pressure, oxymetry. 3. Peripheral venous cannulation
Supraclavicular (SB) group: Supraclavicular block 15 ml lidocaine 2% + 15 ml bupivacaine 0.5% in a double point injection ultrasound guided supraclavicular brachial plexus block
Infraclavicular (IB) group: Infraclavicular block 15 ml lidocaine 2% + 15 ml bupivacaine 0.5% in a triple point injection ultrasound guided infraclavicular brachial plexus block
The duration of each procedure is approximately 15 minutes

primaryOutcome.outcome: brachial artery blood flow measured with ultrasound-doppler at mid arm
primaryOutcome.timepoint: T0: before performing the block T15: 15 minutes after the procedure is completed T30: 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

primaryOutcome.outcome: cephalic vein diameter measured with ultrasound at mid arm
primaryOutcome.timepoint: T0: before performing the block T15: 15 minutes after the procedure is completed T30: 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

primaryOutcome.outcome: brachial artery pulsatility and resistivity indexes measured with ultrasound-doppler at mid arm
primaryOutcome.timepoint: T0: before performing the block T15: 15 minutes after the procedure is completed T30: 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Success rate for surgical anaesthesia : seccess is defined by the absence of pain at skin incision
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 40 minutes, after the procedure is completed

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients requiring hemodialysis and scheuled to elective confection of humeral-cephalic arteriovenous fistula under regional anaesthesia
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Patient refusal 2. Allergy to local anesthetics 3. Existing neurological disorders, neuropathy of the operative extremity 4. Infection at site of needle puncture 5. Coagulation disorders

trial_design.concealment: Subjects for the study will be recruited from the operating list Allocation to study groups will use sealed opaque envelops.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To determine whether ultrasound guided supraclavicular block provides more important increase in brachial artery blood flow and more important vasodilation of the cephalic vein than infraclavicular block. If the primary hypothesis is confirmed, this study will provide evidence supporting the use of the supraclavicular block for the confection of humeral-cephalic arteriovenous fistula.
